Would I recommend playing survivor?

Dead by Daylight Is a very good game but you can have funny moment such as bad moment.
Let me explain you Dead by Daylight if you want to buy it.
DBD ( Dead by daylight ) is an asymetrical game where you can play as a survivor and be with 3 other survivors or as a killer.

As a survivor you'll need to do 5 generators and flee, but you need to be careful because there is a killer and he can kill you. You can escape him with windows or palets. (lockers are very dangerous)

As a Killer you'll need to kill the 4 killers. Before you kill them ,you need to hooked them 3 times and they die by the entity. Of course you can break the generators / pallets.

If you like asymetrical games. I think you can try it.

The game have a lots of updates and tutorials.

Hope I help you !

game is good/addicting. playing with 3 other survivors feels nice, and doing well in chases is exhilarating.

you need to understand the games mechanics and not get mad and say "game bad" if you suck at first. 

been playing since 2017 via console and made the switch 2 years ago.

Do devs listen? No.
Is the game fun? No
Is the game balanced? No
Is the community toxic? Yes
Will i continue to play? Yes
Dwight is cute. So cute in fact, there are these weirdo killers that keep chasing him down to stop him from repairing car engines or something idk. Dwight has a nice butt.

Pros:
-A variety of play-styles is available through the different abilities
-Incredible amount of crossovers from popular horror media and video games. You will see characters from: Halloween, Texas Chainsaw Massacre, Left 4 Dead, Nightmare on Elm Street, Evil Dead, Stranger Things, Silent Hill, Resident Evil, Hellraiser, and Ringu. There are cosmetics from Attack on Titan on the way.
-If you're a person heavily invested in story, you can optionally read into the heavy lore.
-Although the cosmetics cost money, a lot of them are incredibly well made.
-The ranking system is not entirely dependent on whether you escape (as a survivor) or kill every survivor (as a killer). It is also dependent on your performance and contribution to the team in-game. This can help if you suffer from the faults of teammates.

Cons:
-Steep learning curve, there A LOT of perks (special abilities you can equip), powers (exclusive abilities for each killer), and mechanics to memorize. The tutorial won't teach you everything but I definitely recommend doing it regardless (you also get a little reward for doing it).
-Grinding is a big part of the game and sometimes a tedious process
-There is a lot of DLC and frankly, purchasing all of that is really expensive. For any non-crossover characters, you can purchase with them with f2p currency, but it will definitely take a while to collect. Unfortunately, a lot of the best perks are locked behind DLC.
-Community can be a bit toxic at times. It's best to ignore those people. Some will complain about the other side running meta perks while they themselves are running meta perks. 
-Hit registration is sometimes a bit weird but I don't think it's as bad as people say.
-Unbalanced to a degree, some things can work heavily in the favor of one side

Dead by Daylight is an asymmetrical 4 vs 1 multiplayer horror game.
One player is a Killer, and the other four players play as Survivors who are trying to escape.
To escape the survivors have to repair 5 generators to open the 2 exit doors. The killer has to kill the survivors by finding them and hit them down and hang them on a hook. A survivor can be hooked twice, beeing hooked a third time is deadly.
The killer plays in first person while the survivors play in third person.
As of writting there are currently 35 Maps, 22 Killers and 24 survivors.
There are famous Killers from movies in the list, like Freddy Krueger or Michael Myers. Same goes for the survivor side, there are survivors like Ash from Evil Dead Series or Laurie Strode.
From playing games you will receive Bloodpoints. Those Bloodpoints can be used to level up your character and unlock items, offerings and perks in the Bloodweb.
After reaching level 50 you can prestige, meaning you will reset everything you unlocked for your character and you will receive a bloody skin version for your character. You can prestige 3 times.
For people who like to customize their characters, Dead by Daylight has an ingame store for cosmetics and a battle pass.
The game also features crossplay with Playstation players since a while.
Dead by Daylight was released in 2016, so graphics has become a bit dated. However, the developers have started to update the graphics also in terms of the new console generation.
The playerbase is more or less stable around 40,000 concurrent players on Steam.
I think Dead by Daylight is the only asymmetrical multiplayer which is good so far. Even so if the latest update changed the animations and HUD for the worst from my point of view. Other negative aspects of the game are the weird hitboxes and the toxic behavior of some people.
Overall Dead by Daylight is an addictive game and delivers fun for many hours and still gets new content.

Personally, i believe the gamesmanship or lack there of from survivors can really set the tone of a match. Fortunately, smart as you lot think you are with ya flashlights and swfs, i found the appropriate counter to bring them back to earth.....  I play how i want and i dont care how much you sook about getting hung and losing. improve your game play or play something else. Overall, i love this game!
